snippet: The Supreme Court will decide whether to make it much easier for winners in patent suits to force their opponents to pay their legal fees.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that Supreme Court will soon hear two cases that could make it much easier for victors in patent suits to force their opponents to pay their legal fees; reviews history of limits on civil litigation and the emergence of 'patent trolls,' entities that exist solely to buy up patents and reap money from infringement suits.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court will decide whether to make it much easier for winners in patent suits to force their opponents to pay their legal fees.

headline.print_headline: Extracting A Toll From A Patent ‘Troll’
headline.main: Extracting a Toll From a Patent ‘Troll’
